discussion_comments.comment_body: **issue:** Potentially, non-ASCII may be acceptable in path or query components of the URL. This would fail those.

We may want also those (path & query) written in plain ASCII.
Eg [`https://github.com/ցooցle`](https://github.com/ցooցle) with [armenian "ց"](https://www.compart.com/en/unicode/U+0581) should be written with URL-encoded path as [`https://github.com/%D6%81oo%D6%81le`](https://github.com/%D6%81oo%D6%81le) to be visually different from legit [`https://github.com/google`](https://github.com/google).

Github perhaps allows only ASCII in organisation and user names, but the point still stands: Paths are NOT immune to unicode confusion and punnycode is not the solution for paths, but plain old URL encoding is.
I'd rather we be excessively strict for now, provided homebrew/core and homebrew/cask pass, and loosen it later.
